intro: Astracantha muschiana, commonly known as the Muskiana thornveld, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Astracantha muschiana is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
